intro: Tarenna grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered tarenna, is a tropical shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature. Tarenna grandiflora is often found in moist, shaded forest habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
